line: Halt! Who goes there?
Corbyn?
Is that you?

responses.quip: Caldwell! It's been a while! I hope the guard life has been treating you well.
It is! It's nice to see you again, Caldwell. How have you been?
Caldwell, I don't have much time. Do you know where my mother is?

line: There was a time when it was quite frightening for us. But we're a tough bunch, we got through.

responses.quip: Tough? Ha! Stubborn, more like.
You guys are the real heroes. You could've fought those evil monsters without me.

line: Well, ever since the monsters stopped attacking, life has been smooth sailing.
Seeing that you are back in one piece I suppose I have you to thank for that.

responses.quip: No thanks is necessary, I think anyone with the will could have done it.
I suppose so, but it was not without hardships. Speaking of which, do you know where my mother is?

line: Your mother? She doesn't leave home very often nowadays, I bet she's there now. Is everything alright?

responses.quip: Of course, I just want to see her most of all.
No, I need to see her immediately. Goodbye Caldwell.

line: Well that might be true, but we're still kicking reguardless.
I assume you are looking to see your mother?

responses.quip: I am, could you point me in her direction?

line: Oh I doubt that, but on behalf of the town, thank you for your kind words.
I assume you came back to see your mother?

responses.quip: I am, could you point me in her direction?

line: That's very humble of you. Now's the time for the hero to return home now though, eh?
I assume you are going to see your mother?

responses.quip: My mother will always be there. I want to talk to you, Caldwell.
I would like that very much.

line: Ah, that would make sense. I'll let you get to that then. It's nice to see you home.

responses.quip: It's nice to see you too, Caldwell. Goodbye.

line: She doesn't leave home too often nowadays. I bet she's there now.

responses.quip: Thanks Caldwell, I'll talk with you later.
Goodbye, Caldwell.

line: That's very kind of you but I should probably get back to work.
Besides, I know the other townsfolk would be thrilled to talk with you as well. We can talk some more later.

responses.quip: I'll hold you to that. Goodbye, Caldwell.

line: Ah, you should find her at home then. It's nice to see you well, Corbyn.

responses.quip: Thanks for your help. Nice seeing you too.

line: CORBYN! YOU'RE BACK!

responses.quip: Finn! It's nice to see you man.
Hey Finn, excitable as always I see.
It's nice to see you, Finn, but I need to go.

line: You know it! How you been, man? Tell me about your adventures!
Oh Great Corbyn; tamer of beasts, slayer of dragons, controller of...

responses.quip: Okay, okay, I get it. Sure, I've got a story I could tell you.

line: How could I not be when I've heard that my best friend is back from savin' the world?

responses.quip: You are too kind, Finn.
You could have done it, Finn. I'm not special.

line: Where you headed my man? I could go with you.

responses.quip: Thank you, Finn, but that won't be necessary. I'm going to see my mother.
No, Finn. Good bye.

line: I am always down for a story, but I don't really have time for a long one. You got the short and sweet kind too?

responses.quip: Sure man. Is Slider still around? I haven't seen that old mutt yet.
Maybe we should just save the tales for later, I imagine you're skipping out on work right now?

line: Says the man who literally saved us from becoming some gross demon slaves or something.

responses.quip: What are you even talking about?
You're being weird again, Finn.

line: Yeah, sure. Whatever you say, mister Humble Corbyn. Anyways, you have anything you want to do now that you're back in town?

responses.quip: Not much, just checking in with everybody as I go.
Yes, I'm on my way to see my mom.

line: Oh, alright. I suppose we'll talk later then?

responses.quip: Of course, Finn. See you later.
Maybe. Good bye, Finn.

line: Of course he is. That dog's never goin' to heaven, man.

responses.quip: Wonderful. Well, I haven't told anyone yet, but I saw Slider outside the walls last time I stopped by.

line: Who, me? Finn the, uhh...
Faithful?
I should get back to work. I'm already planning your welcome party now, man. You best not pee yourself when we surprise you like you did last time!

responses.quip: What are you talking about...? Oh, he's already gone.

line: Who knows what would have happened. Seriously, man. Thanks.

responses.quip: What's this? Finn acting serious? What have I done?

line: It's my specialty, friendo. You got anything you want to do first since you're back?

responses.quip: Not really, just visiting with everyone again.
I'm on my way to see my mother again. It's been too long.

line: Well, I'm glad I spotted you, then. I gotta get back to work, but I'll talk to you later, yeah?

responses.quip: Of course, man. Talk to you later.
Maybe later, Finn. Good bye.

line: Ah, she's so sweet, man. Whenever I go to visit her, I swear I can't leave without getting a pie or an armful of cookies.

responses.quip: Sounds like her. Talk to you later, man.
I do miss her cooking more than anything. Good bye, Finn.

line: What?! He's crazy, man. How does he even get out?

responses.quip: Right? Well, I went to go get him, and he started howling up a storm. I swear he was singing a song.

line: Oh, shut up. Don't you have somewhere to be?

responses.quip: Yeah, man, I'm going to see my mom. I'll talk to you later.

line: I'm glad I saw you, then. I gotta get back to work now, talk to you later.

responses.quip: Yeah, see you later.

line: Ah, I would be myself if I were you. I'll talk to you later, man.

responses.quip: Yeah, see you.

line: Pshh. Sure he was.

responses.quip: I'm telling you, he was! It was a pretty nice tune, too.

line: Great. I wanted to hear about you running through an orc camp leaving no heads left on shoulders, and instead I get a tall tale about a dumb dog I see every goddamn day.

responses.quip: Hey, you asked for a story, man. Anyways, you need to get back to work. I'm sure you're skipping out on work, and I need to see my mom.

line: I would never skip out on work. Ha ha.
Ha...
Bye.

responses.quip: Bye, Finn.

line: CORBYN!

responses.quip: AHH!
Ugh, not this again.

line: Saved our town from unspeakable evil and still frightened by me?
As it should be.

responses.quip: Somebody had to do it Seymour!
Ugh, not this again.

line: And you weren't ready!

responses.quip: No. I wasn't.
The hell I wasn't. It's dead isn't it?

line: Something does seem off about you. Are you alright?

responses.quip: Of course I am Seymour.
Just exhausted from the journey and happy to be home.
Not exactly. I'm off to see Amelia, is she home?

line: I don't believe you, but if you want to hide it it's not my place to pry.
You will need to explain to Amelia however.

responses.quip: I will. Is she at home? I was on my way to her.
You worry too much Seymour

line: She is. Other than Finn and myself she hasn't been getting too much company either.

responses.quip: I want to see her, do you mind if I go?

line: No. You should go. Goodbye Corbyn.

responses.quip: Goodbye

line: I find that all my years of life have led me to worry just the right amount.
You seem to worry too little.

responses.quip: Don't be so dramatic
I don't have much to worry about right now.

line: Me? Dramatic? Pff Says the hero sauntering back into town.

responses.quip: Would you rather I didn't come back?
I could have died. Aren't you happy that I've returned?

line: I would rather you hadn't left in the first place.
Just go see your mother. I'm done talking with you.

responses.quip: Fine. Goodbye Seymour.

line: Of course I'm happy, but you shouldn't have left in the first place.
You aren't the same.

responses.quip: What are you talking about? I'm fine.
Yes, I have changed, but everything will be alright.

line: No. The more I look, the more something seems wrong. You should go to Amelia now.

responses.quip: I was already on my way to see her. Goodbye Seymour.

line: I should hope so. Go to see Amelia. She's always been the most worried, of course.

responses.quip: Sounds like her. Goodbye Seymour

line: I can see that and it bothers me. You were never like this when you left.

responses.quip: Say Seymour, could you do me a favor?
I should get going. Amelia is at home right?

line: I'm not doing you any favors you don't deserve.

responses.quip: I wan't you to visit Amelia more often
Oh don't worry about it then. I'm off to see Amelia now.

line: That's a bit forboding don't you think? You are okay right?

responses.quip: Of course. No need to worry as I said. I'm going to see her now. She's at home right?

line: She is. Take care Corbyn.

responses.quip: You too Seymour.

line: Goodbye, then.

responses.quip: Goodbye

line: Yes she is, and worried sick no doubt. She will be very happy to see you well.

responses.quip: I hope so. goodbye Seymour.

line: There seems to be more to that story.

responses.quip: There's really no lying to you is there?
Nope, that's that.

line: No, but it's clear you don't want to talk about it, so I won't pry.

responses.quip: Thanks Seymour. I'm going to head home now. Bye.

line: Yes I'm sure. I assume you are on your way to see Amelia. She's at home right now.

responses.quip: Thank you. I'll be on my way.

line: She is, and I'm sure she will be very happy to see you.

responses.quip: I hope so. Goodbye Seymour.

line: While that may be, you are no longer yourself.
Something that could have been prevented had you waited to grow up first.

responses.quip: I should have, but there was no time.
You certainly didn't grow any more fun to talk to while I was away.

line: You weren't a hero when you left, someone could have gone in your place!

responses.quip: Sometimes I wish that someone else did.
But I'm a hero now. People change Seymour

line: Your mother too. You should go see her. She should be at home

responses.quip: Bye Seymour

line: I don't think you've changed for the better.

responses.quip: Thanks. I'll be leaving now.

line: And you certainly haven't grown any more polite despite all my efforts when you were younger.

responses.quip: The adventuring roughed my edges I suppose
Hey, if you don't use it you lose it.

line: They certainly have. I hope you remember to be nice to your mother at least.

responses.quip: Of course I will Seymour. Thank you and goodbye.

line: And you certainly have lost it. I hope you can remember the basics for your mother at least.

responses.quip: Of course I will Seymour. Thank you and goodbye.

line: Don't give me that. I told you you weren't ready and you left anyways.
You deserve worse than a scolding from an old man

responses.quip: Come on Seymour, I'm the Hero! Isn't there any room to spare here?
I'm not going to waste what little time I have left being yelled at by you.

line: You are still a child in my eyes.
You do seem different though, are you alright?

responses.quip: Of course I am!
Just exhausted from my journey and happy to be home is all.
Not exactly. I would like to see Amelia. is she home right now?

line: What do you mean by 'little time?'

responses.quip: Goodbye Seymour

line: Corbyn.

responses.quip: Mother, I'm home.

line: I've missed you so much dear. I'll put on some coffee, tell me about your travels.

responses.quip: Sure mom. Anything you want.
Maybe another time mom.

line: Everything I want just walked in the front door. What can I do for you honey?

responses.quip: Just talk with me.

line: What's wrong dear? You sound sad.

responses.quip: Nothing is wrong mom, I'm just happy to see you.
I'm not well

line: I know something is wrong dear. No matter how much you change I will be able to tell.

responses.quip: I know mom.

line: Well dear? What is it?
You know you can tell me anything.

responses.quip: You know, when I left on my journey, I was so scared that I would never be able to come back.

line: Well you are home now. There is nothing to fear anymore.

responses.quip: As the days passed and I grew stronger. I left that fear behind thinking that nothing, not even dragons, could stop me.

line: And nothing did, right?

responses.quip: When I fought the last evil, I reacted without fear of death.

line: Everything is alright. Right Corbyn?

responses.quip: I had to use every last bit of my power to defeat it...

line: Corbyn?

responses.quip: ... and I have none left now.

line: Everything is okay dear. We can fix it. Things will go back to the way they were.

responses.quip: When I left, I told you that I would come back and... Here I am at long last.

line: Corbyn I love you. Please don't leave again. This isn't fair!

responses.quip: With just enough of me to say one last thing.

line: Please..
Corbyn.
A parent should never outlive there child.

responses.quip: I love you so much mom. Goodbye.
